intro: Cacalia × cuneata, commonly known as the hybrid thimbleweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a clustered inflorescence that resembles a thimble, hence its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
